quiz.title: OR Compound Inequalities
quiz.subtitle: Unit 6 Quiz 7: Solving OR Compound Inequalities
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Solving and Graphing Inequalities Joined by OR (Union)

questions.question: Solve OR graph: $x < -3$ OR $x \geq 2$
questions.explanation: OR means union (either one true). $x < -3$ OR $x \geq 2$ gives two separate regions: left of -3 (open circle) and right of 2 (closed circle).

questions.question: Solve: $2x + 1 < -5$ OR $3x - 2 \geq 10$
questions.explanation: Solve each: $2x + 1 < -5 \rightarrow 2x < -6 \rightarrow x < -3$. OR $3x - 2 \geq 10 \rightarrow 3x \geq 12 \rightarrow x \geq 4$. Solution: $x < -3$ OR $x \geq 4$.

questions.question: Solve: $5 - 2x \leq 1$ OR $3x + 4 > 16$
questions.explanation: Solve each: $5 - 2x \leq 1 \rightarrow -2x \leq -4 \rightarrow x \geq 2$. OR $3x + 4 > 16 \rightarrow 3x > 12 \rightarrow x > 4$. Since $x > 4$ is already entirely contained within the set $x \geq 2$, the union is effectively $x \geq 2$.

questions.question: Which graph represents $x \leq -1$ OR $x > 3$?
questions.explanation: $x \leq -1$: closed at -1, shade left. $x > 3$: open at 3, shade right. OR means we keep both regions on the graph.

questions.question: Solve: $\frac{x}{2} < -2$ OR $\frac{x}{3} \geq 3$
questions.explanation: Solve each: $\frac{x}{2} < -2 \rightarrow x < -4$. OR $\frac{x}{3} \geq 3 \rightarrow x \geq 9$. Solution: $x < -4$ OR $x \geq 9$.

questions.question: Solve: $4(x - 1) < 0$ OR $2x + 5 \geq 15$
questions.explanation: Solve each: $4(x - 1) < 0 \rightarrow 4x - 4 < 0 \rightarrow x < 1$. OR $2x + 5 \geq 15 \rightarrow 2x \geq 10 \rightarrow x \geq 5$. Combined: $x < 1$ OR $x \geq 5$.

questions.question: Which compound inequality has a solution of all real numbers?
questions.explanation: $x > 2$ OR $x \leq 2$ covers every point on the number line. Choice C is incorrect because it excludes the number 2 itself.

questions.question: Solve: $3 - 2x \geq 7$ OR $5x + 1 < -14$
questions.explanation: Solve each: $3 - 2x \geq 7 \rightarrow -2x \geq 4 \rightarrow x \leq -2$. OR $5x + 1 < -14 \rightarrow 5x < -15 \rightarrow x < -3$. In a union (OR), we take everything. Since $x < -3$ is already part of $x \leq -2$, the most inclusive answer is $x \leq -2$.

questions.question: Which graph matches $x < 0$ OR $x > 4$?
questions.explanation: $x < 0$ uses an open circle shaded left. $x > 4$ uses an open circle shaded right. The OR operator keeps both disjoint sets.

questions.question: Solve: $2(3x + 1) \leq -10$ OR $\frac{x - 4}{2} > 3$
questions.explanation: Left side: $6x + 2 \leq -10 \rightarrow 6x \leq -12 \rightarrow x \leq -2$. Right side: $x - 4 > 6 \rightarrow x > 10$. The union is $x \leq -2$ OR $x > 10$.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You master OR compound inequalities: solving, graphing, and understanding union vs intersection.
scoreMessages.70: Strong skills! Focus on: 1) Solving each inequality separately, 2) Combining with OR (union, not overlap), 3) Simplifying when one solution includes the other.
scoreMessages.50: Good progress. Practice: 1) OR means either can be true (union), 2) Graph shows separate regions, 3) Watch for solutions that cover all real numbers.
scoreMessages.0: OR means at least one is true (union). Solve each inequality, then combine. Graph shows all numbers that satisfy EITHER inequality (often two separate regions).
